method: First, calculate the mass of pure CaCO3 in the limestone sample: 5.00 g x 0.840 = 4.20 g. Then calculate moles of CaCO3 using n = m / Mr: n(CaCO3) = 4.20 g / 100.1 g mol-1 = 0.04196 mol. From the balanced equation CaCO3 + 2HCl -> CaCl2 + CO2 + H2O, the mole ratio CaCO3:CO2 is 1:1, so moles of CO2 = 0.04196 mol. Finally, calculate mass of CO2: m = n x Mr = 0.04196 mol x 44.0 g mol-1 = 1.846 g, rounded to 1.85 g for 3 significant figures.
